column1: share on facebookshare on twittershare on emailmore sharing services express sympathy condolences photos erin m. lewis erin m. lewis, 36, of decatur, died saturday (june 20, 2015) at sycamore health care center, where she had resided the past three years. born january 29, 1979 in bulpitt, illinois, erin was the daughter of gerald mc. kee and julitta schneider east. she married donald e. lewis jr. in decatur, illinois on september 11, 2004 and he preceded her in death on september 17, 2010. erin was a member of glad tidings church in decatur, illinois and later the crossing church in quincy. she loved listening to the christian radio music station, and going to the car races to cheer on her favorite driver no. 24, jeff gordon. she enjoyed participating in all of the activities offered at the nursing home and cherished the time spent with her family and her son. erin thought everyday was special and will be remembered for her smile and inspiring those around her. erin was employed at walmart and casey's as a cashier until having to retire due to ill health. survivors include her mother, julitta east (floyd) of quincy, il; a son donovan e. lewis of decatur, il; a brother, ryan mc. kee (bobbie jo) of winchester, il; a sister, tonya mc. kee of springfield, il; paternal grandmother-in-law, erma lewis of decatur, il, one step brother, todd east (brandy) of quincy, il. many loving nieces and nephews, aunts , uncles, and cousins. erin was preceded in death by her father; a sister, hannah l. mc. kee; paternal grandparents, robert and mary mc. kee; maternal grandparents, andrew and darlene schneider; and paternal father-in-law, donald lewis sr. a celebration of life service will be held tuesday afternoon at 3:00 p. m. in the crossing church at 48th and maine in quincy, with pastor chris schaefer officiating visitation will be at tuesday afternoon at the crossing from 2:00 p. m. until the time of service. inurnment will take place at st. john's lutheran church cemetery in decatur at a later date. memorials may be made to the sycamore nursing home health care center. the family would like to thank sycamore health care center for all of their love and support for the care of erin. click to send flowers using our local area florist free delivery to our funeral home & save on wire fees view/sign the condolence book. you have items in your basket. click here to review and/or checkout order directly from our recommended local area florist via our website and save on wire service fees and delivery charges to our funeral home. browse selection. send chocolates. express your condolences by sending a beautiful selection of chocolates, handcrafted in the usa. browse selection. veteran flag cases. we are proud to offer the finest heirloom-quality products to the families of our nation's veterans. browse products. bereavement productsa collection of books and bereavement products carefully designed to assist with the grieving process. browse products click the button to generate a printable document containing all condolences submittedcondolence booklet. add condolence
